{{Infobox set | image = EP1-BoosterEN.jpg | en_name = Exclusive Pack | fr_name = Pack Exclusif | de_name = Exclusive Pack | it_name = Busta in Esclusiva | pt_name = Pack Exclusivo | es_name = Pack Exclusivo | ko_name = 영화 한정 팩 | prefix = EP1 | type = [[Booster Pack]] | size = 8 | cover_card = Theinen the Great Sphinx | en_database_id = 11103002 | fr_database_id = 31103001 | de_database_id = 21103001 | it_database_id = 41103001 | es_database_id = 51102001 | ko_database_id = 78800000 | na_release_date = July 25, 2004 | eu_release_date = August 8, 2004 | fr_release_date = August 8, 2004 | de_release_date = August 8, 2004 | it_release_date = August 8, 2004 | pt_release_date = August 8, 2004 | sp_release_date = August 8, 2004 | kr_release_date = February 18, 2005 }} '''''Exclusive Pack''''' is a special pack in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]''. It was released alongside the film ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! The Movie: Pyramid of Light]]'' and contains cards used by [[Seto Kaiba]] and [[Anubis]] in the film. Each pack contains the same eight cards. The packs were first available for sale at the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! World Championship 2004]], held on July 25, 2004.{{cite web |title=LATEST NEWS! |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/news.asp |website=YU-GI-OH! Trading Card Game |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20041101032236/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/news.asp |archive-date=1 November 2004}} The winners of the [[Kids' WB! Duel of Destiny promotional card|Kids' WB! "Duel of Destiny" Sweepstakes]] also received Exclusive Packs at this event. The Exclusive Pack was made available for purchase at retailers on August 8, 2004,{{cite web |author1=The Upper Deck Co, LLC |title=Upper Deck Entertainment and The Konami Corporation Give First-Look of Never-Before-Seen Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG Exclusive Packs at World Championship Event in July |url=http://www.tradingcardcentral.com/news/2004/05/14_002.php |website=Trading Card Central.com |access-date=7 May 2022 |date=May 14, 2004}} to coincide with the release of ''Yu-Gi-Oh! The Movie: Pyramid of Light''. == Breakdown == Each pack contains 8 cards, including: * 3 [[Ultra Rare]] * 5 [[Common]] ==Galleries== EP1-BoosterEN.jpg | English

{{about|the TCG pack with the prefix TP7|the Japan-exclusive pack with the prefix TP07|Tournament Pack 2008 Vol.3|the Korea-exclusive pack with the prefix TP07|Tournament Pack 2010 Vol.7}} {{Infobox set | image = TP7-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Tournament Pack 7 | fr_name = Pack de Tournoi 7 | de_name = Tournament Pack 7 | it_name = Busta da Torneo 7 | es_name = Paquete de Torneo 7 | type = [[Booster Pack]] | prefix = TP7 | size = 20 | en_database_id = 1121204008 | fr_database_id = 3121203003 | de_database_id = 2121204003 | it_database_id = 4121203003 | es_database_id = 5121203003 | na_release_date = November 1, 2005 | eu_release_date = November 1, 2005 | oc_release_date = November 1, 2005 | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = November 1, 2005 | prev = Tournament Pack 6 | next = Tournament Pack 8 }} '''''Tournament Pack 7''''' is a booster pack that was released to ''[[TCG]]'' tournament locations. It is the seventh ''[[Tournament Pack]]'', following ''[[Tournament Pack 6]]''. This pack is listed on the Portuguese version of the official card database,{{cite web|url={{database link|set|1121204008|link=no|lang=pt}}|title=PACOTE DE TORNEIO 7|language=Portuguese|publisher=[[Konami]]|accessdate=March 5, 2021}} despite not actually being released in Portuguese. ==Breakdown== Each pack contains 3 cards. The set contains 20 cards: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 4 [[Super Rare]]s * 4 [[Rare]]s * 11 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== TP7-BoosterEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Tournament Pack 7 (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] TP7-BoosterFR.png | French

{{Redirect|Magic Ruler|the Japanese set|''Magic Ruler'' (Japanese)|other uses|Magic Ruler (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox set | image = MRL-BoosterNA.png | en_name = Spell Ruler | en_name_2 = Magic Ruler | fr_name = Le Maître des Magies | fr_trans_name = The Magic Master | de_name = Spell Ruler | it_name = Sovrano della Magia | it_trans_name = Magic Ruler | ko_name = 마법의 지배자 | ko_trans_name = Magic Master | ko_rr_name = Mabeob-ui Jibaeja | es_name = Señor de Hechizos | es_trans_name = Spell Lord | type = [[Booster pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = * 104 * 131 (E, F, G, I) | cover_card = Relinquished | en_database_id = 11101002 | fr_database_id = 31101002 | de_database_id = 21101002 | it_database_id = 41101002 | es_database_id = 51101002 | ko_database_id = 71102001 | ae_database_id = 5000000005000 | en_prefix = SRL-EN | na_prefix = MRL | eu_prefix = MRL-E | fr_prefix = MDM-F | de_prefix = SRL-G | it_prefix = SDM-I | sp_prefix = SDH-S | ae_prefix = MRL | kr_prefix = SRL-K | other_sets = ''Spell Ruler'' promotional cards | ae_release_date = October 24, 2002 | kr_release_date = May 7, 2004 | en_release_date = December 1, 2004 | na_release_date = September 16, 2002 | eu_release_date = October 24, 2003 | fr_release_date = October 22, 2003 | de_release_date = October 21, 2003 | it_release_date = December 2003 | sp_release_date = September 1, 2004 | prev = Metal Raiders | next = Pharaoh's Servant }} '''''Spell Ruler''''', previously known as '''''Magic Ruler''''', is a [[Core Booster]] which is a combination of the Japanese sets ''[[Magic Ruler (Japanese)|Magic Ruler]]'' and ''[[Pharaoh's Servant (Japanese)|Pharaoh's Servant]]''. It has been released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG'') in English, French, German, Italian and Spanish and in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. There are three separate prints with different language IDs for the ''TCG'' English sets, North American, European and Worldwide. The North American and Worldwide versions of this set contained 104 cards. Europe initially received the North American English set, i.e. the set with cards numbered MRL-XXX. A European English version was later released containing 27 more cards, which had been excluded from the European versions of ''[[Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon]]'', ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi]]'', and ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]''. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for Constructed tournaments on October 1, 2002.{{cite web |title=Duelist King Tournament |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |website=Upper Deck Entertainment Tournament |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20021201083519/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |archive-date=1 December 2002}} The rename from ''Magic Ruler'' to ''Spell Ruler'' was to go with the renaming of Magic Cards to [[Spell Card]]s. The European and Worldwide English versions of the set used the name ''Spell Ruler''. The European version used the set ID ''MRL'', despite the boosters continuing to be labeled ''Spell Ruler'', while the Worldwide version used the ID ''SRL''. The cards numbered ''SRL-EN'' were included in ''[[Master Collection Volume 1]]''. In 2010, an [[Unlimited Edition]] North American version of the set was reprinted, with SRL [[Set Number]]s, and released as part of the [[Legendary Collection]]. ==Features== This set introduced [[Ritual Spell Card]]s, [[Ritual Monster]]s, [[Quick-Play Spell Card]]s and [[Toon monsters]] to the ''TCG''. Highly sought-after cards in this set include "[[Delinquent Duo]]", "[[Snatch Steal]]", "[[Mystical Space Typhoon]]", "[[Cyber Jar]]", and "[[Painful Choice]]". ==Breakdown== The Asian-English and ''TCG'' versions of this set contained 9 cards per pack and 24 packs per box. The Korean version contained 10 cards per pack. The Worldwide English, North American English, Spanish, Korean and Asian-English versions of this set contained 104 cards, including: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 17 [[Rare]] * 65 [[Common]] The European English, French, German and Italian versions of this set contained 131 cards, including: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 18 [[Rare]] * 91 [[Common]] The additional 27 cards had previously been omitted from other European releases: * 103 to 106: ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi]]'' * 107 to 110: ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]'' * [[Comparison of North American and European Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon|111 to 129]]: ''[[Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon]]'' ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Spell Ruler}} SRL-BoosterEN.png | Worldwide English

{{redirect|MR|the rarity officially abbreviated MR|Mosaic Rare}}
{{Infobox set
| image           = MR-BoosterJP.jpg
| width           = 

| en_name         = Magic Ruler
| ja_name         = ﻿{{Ruby|Ｍａｇｉｃ Ｒｕｌｅｒ|マジック・ルーラー}} －{{Ruby|魔|ま}}{{Ruby|法|ほう}}の{{Ruby|支|し}}{{Ruby|配|はい}}{{Ruby|者|しゃ}}－
| romaji_name     = Majikku Rūrā - Mahō no Shihaisha -

| type            = [[Booster Pack]]
| series          = Core Booster

* [[Relinquished]]

| jp_release_date = April 20, 2000

'''''Magic Ruler''''' is a Japanese [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG''). It is the first Core Booster in the ''OCG'' [[Series 2]].

Its name comes from the high volume of [[Spell Card]]s, which are known as Magic Cards in the Japanese version and were previously known as Magic Cards in other languages.

In the ''[[TCG]]'' and Korean ''OCG'', this set was combined with ''[[Pharaoh's Servant (Japanese)|Pharaoh's Servant]]'' and released as ''[[Magic Ruler]]'' (although it was later renamed ''Spell Ruler'').

This set has been reprinted in the ''[[Duelist Legacy Volume.1]]'', which features the same [[cover card]]s "[[Relinquished]]" and "[[Spellbinding Circle]]".

==Features==
* Includes cards used by [[Dark Yugi (manga)|Dark Yugi]], [[Bandit Keith (manga)|Bandit Keith]] and [[Maximillion J. Pegasus (manga)|Maximillion J. Pegasus]]
* Includes members and/or support for the "[[Archfiend]]" and "[[Gravekeeper]]" archetypes.
* This booster comes with cards which were video game-only at that time, including "[[High Tide Gyojin]]", "[[Whiptail Crow]]", "[[Dark Witch]]", "[[Axe of Despair]]", "[[Malevolent Nuzzler]]" and "[[Guardian of the Throne Room]]".
* This is the first set to contain a [[Ritual Monster]] after ''[[Dark Ceremony Edition]]''. ''Magic Ruler'' introduces [[Quick-Play Spell Card]]s to the ''OCG''.
* ''Magic Ruler'' contains highly sought after Spell Cards, including "[[Snatch Steal]]", "[[The Forceful Sentry]]", "[[Mystical Space Typhoon]]" and "[[Giant Trunade]]".

==Breakdown==

Each pack contained 5 cards and each box contained 30 packs.

The set contained 50 cards, or 53 in the [[Master Set]]. This comprised of:
* 3 [[Ultra Parallel Rare]]
* 3 [[Ultra Rare]]
* 4 [[Super Rare]]
* 4 [[Rare]]
* 39 [[Common]]

[[Category:OCG Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = MFC-BoosterNA.png | en_name = Magician's Force | ko_name = 매지션의 힘 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Maejisyeon-ui Him | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 108 | cover_card = [[Dark Paladin]] | en_database_id = 11102003 | ko_database_id = 71102005 | ae_database_id = 5000000012000 | na_prefix = MFC | ae_prefix = MFC | kr_prefix = MFC-KR | other_sets = ''Magician's Force'' promotional cards | na_release_date = October 10, 2003 | ae_release_date = January 22, 2004 | kr_release_date = March 8, 2005 | prev = Pharaonic Guardian | next = Dark Crisis }} '''''Magician's Force''''' is a [[Core Booster]], which combines the Japanese sets ''[[Advent of Union]]'' and ''[[Champion of Black Magic]]''. It has been printed in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' in English and in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for Constructed tournaments on November 17, 2003.{{cite web |title=Duelist King Tournament |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |website=Upper Deck Entertainment Tournament |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20031204051808/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/tournament/rules.asp |archive-date=4 December 2003}} In October 19, 2011 the set was re-released in South Korea in Korean. The boxes came with a flap that could be exchanged for the ''[[Magician's Force promotional cards]]''. In November 2019, the set was re-released in South Korea in Korean. as part of a reprint season including some other old packs. It was reprinted as originally released; in its original box style. ==Features== It contains a new set of cards called [[Union Monster]]s, with the ability to combine and strengthen other monsters, along with plenty of [[Spellcaster]]-[[Type]] monsters and support cards. It contains the "[[Amazoness]]" archetype and introduces the [[Spell Counter]] mechanic in which certain cards could only be played by removing a number of "spell counters" which are usually acquired by playing Spell cards. Highly sought after cards include "[[Dark Magician Girl]]", "[[Breaker the Magical Warrior]]", "[[Tribe-Infecting Virus]]", "[[Magical Scientist]]" and "[[Chaos Command Magician]]". This is the first Core Booster to fully use the term "[[Spell Card]]", after the rename from "Magic Card", despite later prints of ''Pharaonic Guardian'' doing such. ==Breakdown== In the English and Asian-English versions of this set, each pack contains 9 cards and each box contains 24 packs. In the Korean version, there are 5 cards per pack. The set contains 108 cards, including: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 17 [[Rare]] * 69 [[Common]] ==Galleries== MFC-BoosterNA.png | North American English
[[Set Card Galleries:Magician's Force (TCG-NA-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Magician's Force (TCG-NA-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] MFC-BoosterAE.png | Asian-English
[[Set Card Galleries:Magician's Force (OCG-AE-1E)|1st Edition]] MFC-BoosterKR.png | Korean
[[Set Card Galleries:Magician's Force (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Magician's Force (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] MFC-BoosterBoxEN.jpg | English box ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = NA,AE,KR | 1e_galleries = NA,AE,KR | ue_galleries = NA,KR }} {{Set list tabs|NA,AE,KR}} ==References== {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:International Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = EEN-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Elemental Energy | fr_name = Énergie Elémentaire | de_name = Elemental Energy | it_name = Energia Elementale | es_name = Energía Elemental | ja_name = エレメンタル・エナジー | romaji_name = Erementaru Enajī | ko_name = 절대원소의 힘 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Jeoldaewonsoui Him | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 60 | order_number = 406 | cover_card = [[Elemental HERO Shining Flare Wingman]] | ja_database_id = 1108001 | en_database_id = 11104006 | fr_database_id = 31104006 | de_database_id = 21104006 | it_database_id = 41104006 | es_database_id = 51103006 | ko_database_id = 71105001 | ae_database_id = 5000000031000 | prefix = EEN | ae_prefix = EEN-AE | sneak_peek = yes | vendor_edition = yes | special_edition = yes | jp_release_date = August 11, 2005 | ae_release_date = July 20, 2006 | kr_release_date = May 17, 2007 | en_release_date = November 16, 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr_release_date = November 5, 2005 | de_release_date = November 1, 2005 | it_release_date = November 5, 2005 | sp_release_date = November 5, 2005 | prev = Cybernetic Revolution | next = Shadow of Infinity }} '''''Elemental Energy''''' is a [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the sixth Core Booster of [[Series 4]]. This set has been printed in the ''TCG'' in English, French, German, Italian and Spanish and in the ''OCG'' in Japanese, [[Asian-English]] and Korean. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for premier events on December 1, 2005.{{cite web |title=Products |url=http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/yugioh/en/products.aspx |website=YU-GI-OH! Trading Card Game |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20060115105133/http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/yugioh/en/products.aspx |archive-date=15 January 2006}}{{cite web |title=UDE Tournament Appendix Appendix A: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG Policies |url=http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01nov2005_en.doc |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060307213135/http://entertainment.upperdeck.com:80/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01nov2005_en.doc |archive-date=7 March 2006 |format=doc |date=1 November 2005}} This set was also released with the ''[[Elemental Energy: Special Edition]]'', with one of four variant cards; "[[Silent Swordsman LV5]]", "[[Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV8]]", "[[The Creator]]", or "[[Sacred Phoenix of Nephthys]]". In December 20, 2019, the set was re-released in South Korea in Korean. as part of a reprint season including many other old packs. It was reprinted as originally released; in its original box style. ==Features== * Introduced cards used by [[Jaden Yuki]], [[Chazz Princeton]], [[Yami Yugi]], [[Alexis Rhodes]] and [[Bastion Misawa]]. * Includes members and/or support for the "[[Elemental HERO]]", "[[B.E.S.]]", "[[Ojama]]" and "[[Djinn]]" archetypes; and the "[[VWXYZ]]" series (expansion of the "XYZ" series). * Introduces the "[[Dark World]]", "[[Familiar-Possessed]]" and "[[Bonding]]" archetypes and the "[[Cyber Girl]]", "[[Chthonian]]" and "[[Three Musketeers of Face Cards]]" series to the OCG/TCG. *Highly sought after cards included "[[Pot of Avarice]]" and the "[[Dark World]]" cards. ==Breakdown== In the Japanese version of this set, each pack contains 5 cards and each box contains 30 packs. In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English versions, each pack contains 9 cards and each box contains 24 packs. The Japanese set contains 60 cards in total or 71 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 11 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 35 [[Common]] The ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean version contains 60 cards in total or 85 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 25 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 35 [[Common]] ==Galleries== EEN-BoosterEN.png | English

{{About|the set|the card of the same name|""Cybernetic Revolution"" (card)}} {{Infobox set | image = CRV-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Cybernetic Revolution | fr_name = Révolution Cybernétique | de_name = Cybernetic Revolution | it_name = Rivoluzione Cibernetica | pt_name = Revolução Cibernética | es_name = Revolución Cibernética | ja_name = サイバネティック・レボリューション | romaji_name = Saibanetikku Reboryūshon | ko_name = 사이버 혁명 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Saibeo Hyeongmyeong | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 60 | cover_card = [[Cyber End Dragon]] | ja_database_id = 1108000 | en_database_id = 11104004 | fr_database_id = 31104004 | de_database_id = 21104004 | it_database_id = 41104004 | pt_database_id = 11104004 | es_database_id = 51103004 | ko_database_id = 71105000 | ae_database_id = 5000000029000 | order_number = 405 | prefix = CRV | fr_prefix = CRV-FR | it_prefix = CRV-IT | pt_prefix = CRV-PT | sp_prefix = CRV-SP | ae_prefix = CRV-AE | sneak_peek = yes | vendor_edition = yes | jp_release_date = May 26, 2005 | ae_release_date = April 20, 2006 | kr_release_date = February 5, 2007 | en_release_date = August 17, 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr_release_date = August 6, 2005 | de_release_date = August 1, 2005 | it_release_date = August 6, 2005 | pt_release_date = August 1, 2005 | sp_release_date = August 6, 2005 | prev = The Lost Millennium | next = Elemental Energy }} '''''Cybernetic Revolution''''' is a [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the fifth Core Booster of [[Series 4]]. This set has been printed in the ''TCG'' in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish and in the ''OCG'' in Japanese, [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. This is the last set to be printed in Portuguese, until ''[[Cosmo Blazer]]'', which was released over seven years later. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for premier events on September 1, 2005.{{cite web |title=Products |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/en/products.aspx |website=YU-GI-OH! Trading Card Game |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050924194423/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/yugioh/en/products.aspx |archive-date=24 September 2005}}{{cite web |title=UDE Tournament Appendix Appendix A: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG Policies |url=http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01aug2005_en.doc |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070227020635/http://entertainment.upperdeck.com:80/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01aug2005_en.doc |archive-date=7 March 2006 |format=doc |date=1 August 2005}} Its main focus is cards used in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]]'' anime series. More specifically, the [[Machine]]-[[Type]] monsters used by [[Zane Truesdale|Zane]] and [[Syrus Truesdale]], including "[[Cyber Dragon (archetype)|Cyber Dragon]]" cards and the "[[roid]]" archetype. In October 25, 2019, the set was re-released in South Korea in Korean, as part of a reprint season including some other old packs. It was reprinted as originally released; in its original box style.[http://www.card09.com/goods_detail.php?goodsIdx=2395 card09.com] [OCG] 사이버혁명 ==Features== * Includes cards used by [[Syrus Truesdale]], [[Jaden Yuki]], and [[Zane Truesdale]]. * Includes members and/or support for the "[[B.E.S.]]","[[Frog]]" and "[[Elemental HERO]]" archetypes, as well as the [[itsu]] series. * Introduces the "[[Cyber Dragon]]", "[[roid]]s" archetypes, as well as the [[Spiritual Art]] series, to the OCG/TCG. ==Breakdown== In the Japanese version, each pack contains 5 cards and each box contains 30 packs. In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English versions, each pack contains 9 cards and each box contains 24 packs. The Japanese set contains 60 cards in total or 71 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 11 [[Ultimate Rare]]s * 4 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 7 [[Super Rare]]s * 14 [[Rare]]s * 35 [[Common]]s The ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean version contains 60 cards in total or 85 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 25 [[Ultimate Rare]]s * 4 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 7 [[Super Rare]]s * 14 [[Rare]]s * 35 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== CRV-BoosterEN.png | English

{{Infobox set | image = DR2-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Dark Revelation Volume 2 | fr_name = Sombre Révélation Volume 2 | de_name = Dark Revelation Volume 2 | it_name = Rivelazione Oscura Volume 2 | es_name = Revelación Oscura Volumen 2 | type = [[Booster Pack]] | prefix = DR2 | size = 224 | cover_card = * [[Black Luster Soldier - Envoy of the Beginning]] * [[Dark Magician of Chaos]] * [[The End of Anubis]] | en_database_id = 11104005 | fr_database_id = 31104005 | de_database_id = 21104005 | it_database_id = 41104005 | es_database_id = 51103005 | en_release_date = October 20, 2005 | de_release_date = October 1, 2005 | fr_release_date = October 20, 2005 | it_release_date = October 20, 2005 | sp_release_date = October 20, 2005 | next = Dark Revelation Volume 3 | prev = Dark Revelation Volume 1 }} '''''Dark Revelation Volume 2''''' is the fourth [[reprint]] set in the ''TCG''. This set is the same set as ''[[Expert Edition Volume.2]]'' in the Japanese ''[[OCG]]''. ==Features== Every pack has 13 cards—instead of the normal 9—and a "[[Tip Card]]", which has a special tip to increase your game knowledge. ''Dark Revelation'' (and all other [[Reprint]] Packs) always contain 6 [[Monster Cards]], 3 [[Trap Cards]], 3 [[Spell Cards]], 1 [[Tip Card]] and 1 or even 2 rares. This set contains cards from ''[[Invasion of Chaos]]'' and ''[[Ancient Sanctuary]]''. ==Breakdown== * 15 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 20 [[Super Rare]]s * 30 [[Rare]]s * 159 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== DR2-BoosterEN.png | English

{{For|the Japanese set|''[[Expert Edition Volume.1]]''}} {{Infobox set | image = DR1-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Dark Revelation Volume 1 | fr_name = Sombre Révélation 1 | de_name = Dark Revelations Volume 1 | it_name = Rivelazione Oscura Vol.1 | pt_name = Revelação Negra Volume 1 | es_name = Revelación Oscura Volumen 1 | type = [[Booster Pack]] | prefix = DR1 | order_number = | size = 267 | en_database_id = 11104001 | fr_database_id = 31104001 | de_database_id = 21104001 | it_database_id = 41104001 | pt_database_id = 11104001 | es_database_id = 51103001 | na_release_date = March 19, 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | de_release_date = June 1, 2005 | fr_release_date = March 19, 2005 | it_release_date = March 19, 2005 | pt_release_date = March 1, 2005 | sp_release_date = March 19, 2005 | next = Dark Revelation Volume 2 }} '''''Dark Revelation Volume 1''''' is the sixteenth [[Booster Pack]] in the ''[[TCG]]''. The second [[reprint]] set in the ''TCG'', it contains most cards from ''[[Pharaonic Guardian]]'' to ''[[Dark Crisis]]''. It contains cards with decreased rarity. This set was also the first to contain [[Tip Card]]s, which had not yet been released in Booster Packs. ==Features== Every pack contains 12 cards instead of the usual 9, and a "[[Tip Card]]", which has a special tip to increase your game knowledge. ''Dark Revelation'' (and all other [[Reprint]] Packs) always contain 6 [[Monster Card]]s, 3 [[Spell Card]]s, 3 [[Trap Card]]s, 1 [[Tip Card]] and 1 or even 2 [[Rare]]s. ==Trivia== * [[Yami Yugi]]'s appearance on the cover of this booster pack is taken from the title page for {{chapter|Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist|76|ref}}. However, the traditional playing cards are replaced with ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]'' trading cards, and a [[Duel Disk]] is added to his arm. This was also used earlier for ''[[Expert Edition Volume.1]]''. ==Breakdown== * 15 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 20 [[Super Rare]]s * 30 [[Rare]]s * 202 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Dark Revelation Volume 1}} DR1-BoosterEN.png | English

{{For|other uses|''Dark Beginning 2'' (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox set | image = DB2-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Dark Beginning 2 | fr_name = Genèse Ténébreuse 2 | de_name = Dark Beginning 2 | it_name = Inizio Oscuro 2 | es_name = Principio Oscuro 2 | type = [[Booster Pack]] | prefix = DB2 | order_number = | size = 250 | cover_card = * [[Blade Knight]] * [[Time Wizard]] * [[Swift Gaia the Fierce Knight]] * [[Obnoxious Celtic Guard]] | en_database_id = 11104003 | fr_database_id = 31104003 | de_database_id = 21104003 | it_database_id = 41104003 | es_database_id = 51103003 | na_release_date = July 27, 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr_release_date = July 22, 2005 | de_release_date = July 27, 2005 | it_release_date = July 22, 2005 | sp_release_date = July 22, 2005 | prev = Dark Beginning 1 }} '''''Dark Beginning 2''''' is a reprint set in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]''. This set is the ''TCG'' version of the ''[[OCG]]'' reprint set ''[[Beginner's Edition 2]]'', containing the exact same cards. As a result, this reprint set actually contains 2 cards that are new to the ''TCG''. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for premier events upon its release{{cite web |title=UDE Tournament Appendix Appendix A: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG Policies |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01aug2005_en.pdf |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060108041138/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/op/policy/files/en/UDEAppendixAYGO01aug2005_en.pdf |archive-date=8 January 2006 |format=pdf |date=1 August 2005 |page=3}} on July 27, 2005. ==Features== ''Dark Beginning 2'' contains mostly reprints of [[Core Booster]] cards from ''[[Labyrinth of Nightmare]]'' through ''[[Pharaonic Guardian]]'', as well as ''[[Metal Raiders]]'', with decreased rarity. In addition, it contains many cards not previously released in [[Booster Pack]]s in the ''TCG''. ==Breakdown== Each pack contains 13 cards, consisting of 6 [[Monster Card]]s, 3 [[Trap Card]]s, 3 [[Spell Card]]s, and 1 [[Tip Card]]. Each pack contains 1 or 2 Rares. Contains 12 ''TCG'' cards per pack, 24 packs per box. Includes 250 cards, comprising: * 15 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 20 [[Super Rare]]s * 30 [[Rare]]s * 185 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== DB2-BoosterEN.png | English
